definition: to see the world/to go out into society/to gain experience
to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)

sentences.english: Life often makes fun of those who haven't been around.
sentences.chinese: 生活常常捉弄涉世不深的人。

sentences.english: Bought lemonade from an unlicensed "dealer" in the form of an innocent child?
sentences.chinese: 在一個沒有營業執照的涉世不深的小孩那買汽水？

sentences.english: She was then a girl of little life.
sentences.chinese: 那時，她是個涉世不深的女孩子。

sentences.english: Most of those students are still wet behind the ears.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的學生仍涉世不深。

sentences.english: He was as experienced as his brother was green.
sentences.chinese: 他經驗豐富，而他兄弟卻涉世未深。

sentences.english: They won't let their daughter date because she's still too wet behind the ears.
sentences.chinese: 他們不會讓女兒去約會，因爲她仍涉世不深。

sentences.english: The following 10 pieces of advice accumulated by forthgoers are helpful to you.
sentences.chinese: 以下是一些先行者積累的10條有益的涉世忠告。

sentences.english: She's so naive that she believes everything he tells her.
sentences.chinese: 她涉世不深以致相信他所告訴她的每一件事。

sentences.english: You can't depend on him. He's just a babe in arms.
sentences.chinese: 你不能依賴他，他只是是一個涉世未深的毛頭小子。

sentences.english: You Are like A baby in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 你是個涉世未深的毛孩子。

sentences.english: Some of the young actors are still wet behind the ears.
sentences.chinese: 一些年輕的演員仍涉世不深。

sentences.english: In inflicting penalties, the age and inexperience of the guilty party must always be taken into account.
sentences.chinese: 判刑時必須始終考慮罪犯的年齡與涉世不深。

sentences.english: The fact is suckers never get an even break.
sentences.chinese: 事實是涉世未深的人從來得不到公平的機會。

definition: worldly wisdom/the ways of the world/to know how to get on in the world
affairs of life/things of the world
worldly affairs/the ways of the world
to be versed in/to know well
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous
